Package pr1.helper.extension

Class Collector<T extends java.lang.Number>

  • java.lang.Object
    • pr1.helper.extension.Collector<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of Number to be collected
    public class Collector<T extends java.lang.Number>
extends java.lang.Object
    A generic accumulator for numeric values that internally stores the sum as a double.

    This class accepts any Number subtype (e.g., Integer, Double, Long, etc.) and accumulates or sets their numeric values. Non-double numbers are converted using Number.intValue() for compatibility with legacy or integer-based contexts, while Double values are preserved with full precision.

    null inputs are safely ignored in all operations.

    Since:
    2025
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Benjamin Wagner

    • Constructor Detail

      • Collector

        public Collector()

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public void add​(T value)
        Adds the numeric value of the given Number to the internal sum.

        If the argument is null, this method does nothing. If the argument is an instance of Double, its doubleValue() is used; otherwise, intValue() is used for conversion.

        Parameters:
        value - the number to be added to the sum, or null to skip

      • set

        public void set​(T value)
        Sets the internal sum to the numeric value of the given Number, replacing any previous value.

        If the argument is null, this method does nothing. If the argument is an instance of Double, its doubleValue() is used; otherwise, intValue() is used for conversion.

        Parameters:
        value - the number to be set as the new sum, or null to skip

      • getSum

        public double getSum()
        Returns the current sum as a double.
        Returns:
        the accumulated sum with double precision

      • getSumAsInteger

        public int getSumAsInteger()
        Returns the current sum as an int, truncating any fractional part.
        Returns:
        the accumulated sum converted to an integer
